titleStmt.title: The lavvyers light: or, A due direction for the study of the law for methode. Choyce of bookes moderne. Selection of authours of more antiquitie. Application of either. Accommodation of diuers other vsefull requisits. All tending to the speedy and more easie attayning of the knowledge of the common law of this kingdome. With necessary cautions against certaine abuses or ouersights, aswell in the practitioner as student. Written by the reuerend and learned professor thereof, I.D. To which is annexed for the affinitie of the subiect, another treatise, called The vse of the law.
titleStmt.author: Doddridge, John, Sir, 1555-1628.
Bacon, Francis, 1561-1626, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: [By Bernard Alsop and Thomas Fawcet] for Beniamin Fisher, and are to be sold at his shop in Aldersgate street, at the signe of the Talbot,

notesStmt.note: "The vse of the lavv" has separate dated title page, pagination and register. It is anonymous, and has been attributed with doubtful validity to Francis Bacon.
The first leaf and the last leaf are blank.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
